content: this legal case involves a coownership community and a real estate property the case has been ongoing for 6 years and the final resolution is that the coownership will be dissolved and the property will be sold through a public auction the proceeds from the sale will be divided among the coowners based on their shares the proposer owns 56 parts of the property and the counterparty owns 16 part the court determined that a geometric division of the property is not possible without reducing its value so it will be sold through a public auction expert findings indicate that the property consists of 4 apartments and a garage each with different areas and market values the parties have discussed dividing the property into condominium ownership but the proposer objected due to lack of consensus and high costs the counterparty disagreed with the experts findings and proposed being assigned the smallest apartment without additional payment or a different apartment with an additional payment the court ultimately decided to terminate the coownership and divide the property according to the provisions of the property act
